citation.article-title: Brevibacterium avium sp. nov., isolated from poultry.

p.s: Description of Brevibacterium avium sp. nov.
Brevibacterium avium (a'vi.um. L. n. avis a bird; L. gen. pl. n. avium of birds)
This description is based on the results of the present study and the findings of Mohan (1981).
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, non-acid-fast, non-sporeforming rods which exhibit a coryneform morphology.
Branching is not observed.
Colonies are convex, with entire margin, round, smooth, greyish-white in colour and of butyrous consistency.
Good growth occurs at 22,30 and 37°C but is optimal at 37°C.
The organism is catalase- and oxidase-positive and has a respiratory mode of metabolism.
Tyrosine is decomposed and extracellular DNase is produced.
Casein, gelatin and xanthine are hydrolysed but aesculin, starch and urea are not.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
No acid is produced from glucose, maltose, mannitol, sucrose or xylose.

L-Arabinose, D-arabitol, galactose, D-glucose, glycerol, D-fructose, D-mannose and mannitol are utilized but adonitol, amygdalin, D-arabinose, Larabitol, arbutin, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, Dfucose, L-fucose, β-gentiobiose, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, N-acetylglucosamine, methyl α-D-glucoside, glycogen, inositol, inulin, lactose, D-lyxose, maltose, methyl α-D-mannoside, melezitose, melibiose, D-raffinose, rhamnose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, L-sorbose, starch, sucrose, D-tagatose, trehalose, D-turanose, xylitol, D-xylose, L-xylose and methyl β-xyloside are not.

Alkaline and acid phosphatase, esterase C4, ester lipase C8, leucine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase and phosphoamidase are detected but lipase C14, valine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, pgalactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-mannosidase activities are not.
The peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid.
Galactose is present in the cell wall but not arabinose.
Mycolic acids are not present.
Isolated from bumble-foot-like manifestations of poultry, though their pathogenic role is unclear.
Isolates have been found to be non-pathogenic for experimentally injected animals and are thought to be secondary invaders (Mohan, 1981).
The type strain is NCIMB 703055T.
